items.headline: Oracle’s stock is rising. Why TikTok’s U.S. deal could be good news for the tech company.
items.summary_en: A memo from TikTok’s top executive reportedly says that the social-media phenomenon inked deals to create a U.S. joint venture, with Oracle’s cloud business as its backbone.

items.headline: My mother ghosted me after my father died. Is she stealing his money?

items.headline: Nike says turnaround plans are ‘in the middle innings,’ but investor worries remain
items.summary_en: Nike Inc. reported fiscal second-quarter results that beat Wall Street’s expectations, but its margins shrank, and management said the sneaker and athletic-gear giant was “in the middle innings” of its comeback plan.

items.headline: ‘I’m terrified I’ll be homeless when my husband, 76, stops working’: We only have $100K. What happens to people like us?

items.headline: Marijuana stocks sell off as Trump signs executive order to reclassify cannabis
items.summary_en: President Trump on Thursday signed an executive order asking the U.S. government to reschedule cannabis — a move that analysts and industry executives called the most significant federal reform on the substance in decades.

items.headline: ‘He never asks for anything’: I’m 61 with a $1.5 million 401(k). My girlfriend says I do too much for my son, 28. Is she right?
items.summary_en: “I recently gave him $20,000 for a newer car and had him finance the rest.”
